application.doc: Retrieving the list of all existing CORS Policies

method.name: GET
method.id: Retrieving the list of all existing CORS Policies
method.doc: To retrieve the list of all existing CORS Policies with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP GET command on the CORS Policies resource URI.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

response.doc: There is a problem with the request. The JSON message describes the problem.
File not Found, The requested service does not exist. The JSON message indicates which resource.
An internal error occurred. The JSON message indicates the problem.

representation.name: showCorsPolicyJsonResponse
representation.doc: Note: Response body is an array.

param.name: name
param.doc: The name of this CORS policy.

param.name: allowed_origins
param.doc: An array of origins which are allowed to make cross origin requests to this resource. A value of * indicates that any origin will be allowed.

param.name: allow_credentials
param.doc: Controls whether or not the Access-Control-Allow-Credentials header will be set.

param.name: exposed_headers
param.doc: The values populated in the Access-Control-Expose-Headers header.

param.name: handle_preflight
param.doc: Indicates whether or not the Reverse Proxy is handling pre-flight requests.

param.name: allowed_methods
param.doc: The methods permitted in pre-flight requests and the subsequent Access-Control-Allow-Methods header. This option only relates to pre-flight requests handled by the Reverse Proxy. Methods are case sensitive and simple methods (eg: GET, HEAD and POST) are always implicitly allowed.

param.name: allowed_headers
param.doc: The headers permitted in pre-flight requests and the subsequent Access-Control-Allow-Headers header. This option only relates to pre-flight requests handled by the Reverse Proxy.

param.name: max_age
param.doc: The Access-Control-Max-Age header added to pre-flight requests. If set to zero, the header will not be added to pre-flight responses. If set to -1, clients will be told not to cache at all. This option only relates to pre-flight requests handled by the Reverse Proxy.
